channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Senators take first step toward reopening the government after historic shutdown
item.description: The Senate voted late Sunday evening on a compromise that could reopen the government following the longest shutdown in history.

item.title: 11/9: Sunday Morning
item.description: Hosted by Jane Pauley. Featured: Research in early-onset Alzheimer’s, “Landman” star Billy Bob Thornton, “Hamnet” actress Jessie Buckley, the psychic ...

item.title: Senate advances funding measure, moving a step closer to ending shutdown
item.description: On Day 40 of the shutdown, eight Democrats joined Republicans in advancing a government funding measure, after 14 previous votes fell short.

item.title: Watch: Thune says he's hopeful government shutdown will end ahead of vote on key funding bill
item.description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune said he was "hopeful that we can finally bring the shutdown to an end" ahead of a vote to advance a key funding bill...

item.title: Gov. Greg Abbott announces run for fourth term, touts property tax plan, economy
item.description: Gov. Greg Abbott announced on Sunday evening that he is running for a fourth term as governor of the Lone Star State.

item.title: Seven dead after migrant boat sinks near Thai-Malaysia border
item.description: Hundreds of Rohingyas, who fled Myanmar in hopes of a better life in Malaysia, remain missing.

item.title: 11/9/2025: The Family Farm; Collateral Damage; The Indomitable Margaret Atwood
item.description: First, a report on the high costs and tariffs hammering U.S. farmers. Then, what happens when research funding for universities is cut. And, Margaret ...

item.title: Some UPS and FedEx planes are grounded. What does that mean for holiday shipping?
item.description: UPS and FedEx's fleets of MD-11 planes are grounded, which can each carry thousands of packages. Logistics experts say some cargo could shift to passe...

item.title: MLB pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz charged with taking bribes to rig pitches
item.description: Two Major League Baseball pitchers have been indicted on charges they took bribes to give bettors advance notice of the types of pitches they'd throw ...

item.title: Paul Tagliabue, NFL commissioner for 17 years, dies at 84
item.description: Paul Tagliabue, who helped bring labor peace and riches to the NFL during his 17 years as commissioner but was criticized for not taking stronger acti...

item.title: BBC director resigns after criticism of the broadcaster's editing of a Trump speech
item.description: The BBC said that director-general Tim Davie and head of news Deborah Turness have resigned after criticism of the broadcaster's editing of a speech b...

item.title: College students, stressed about federal food aid uncertainty, look to campuses for support
British man dies after being shot during robbery in Ghana
item.description: A manhunt is under way for the 68-year-old's killer and other suspects who were at the scene in Tema.

item.title: Trump administration demands states ‘undo’ full SNAP payouts as states warn of ‘catastrophic impact’
Harshita was murdered a year ago - so why has her killer not been caught, family ask
item.description: Police have charged Harshita Brella's husband with murder - but, despite sightings, he remains on the run.

item.title: Shutdown could reduce US flights 'to a trickle', transport secretary warns
item.description: US lawmakers are working over the weekend as they seek a bipartisan deal to end the shutdown, which is now on day 40.

item.title: Mystery 'fedora man' at Louvre heist scene revealed as teenage detective fan
item.description: The mystery youth in the photo turns out to be Pedro Elias Garzon Delvaux, a 15-year-old detective fan.

item.title: US airlines’ daily cancellations exceed 2,700 as shutdown impact extends
